page.title: 09ARTS AND CRAFTS
page.content: Bewdley was a prosperous town in {Georgian}times with many craft industries based on the products of the{Wyre Forest.}Bark Hill used to be where oak bark was stripped and used for{tanning leather.}Charcoal was made from Wych Elm.The pine trees were used as pit props for the Midland coal mines.{Besoms(or brooms)}barrels , coracles (a small fishing boat)and horn carving are associated with the Forest.In addition there were other crafts of pewtering, brass foundaries, rope and glove making and glass blowing.{Cap making}dated from Tudor times , and employed a thousand people at one time. The memory of these ancient crafts is kept alive in Bewdley Museum, either in static displays or by craftsmen giving demonstrations of their art.
